Subjective: Left ear pain and fullness, like water in ear. Gradually worsening over 3-4 days. Pain rated 0-4/10 daily, 6-7/10 after showering. Difficulty hearing with left ear. Unable to swim due to pain exacerbation. Occasional cotton bud use 3x/week. No fever, no general malaise. Pain manageable, not taking analgesia. Request: Evaluate left ear, improve hearing, relieve pain. Concerns: Hearing loss, ear condition. Social: Recently became Dutch citizen. No smoking/alcohol.
Objective: Vitals: Temp 36.2 C. Right ear: Normal canal, normal tympanic membrane. Left ear: Canal red, swollen, inflamed. Tympanic membrane obscured. Pain on traction.
Assessment: Otitis externa, left. Likely secondary to water exposure and minor trauma from cotton bud use. No signs of otitis media.
Plan:
1. Analgesia: Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day PRN.
2. Ear drops: Anti-inflammatory, acidic drops (e.g., Otodine) 3x/day for 1 week.
3. Hygiene: Avoid cotton bud use.
4. Lifestyle: Keep left ear dry for 1 week.
5. Follow-up: Return in 1 week for re-evaluation.
6. Safety netting: Return sooner if pain worsens significantly, discharge develops, or fever occurs.
